I find on evps if you have to clean it more then twice leave it alone if on=
ce or twice is a good thing and it comes out clear you are good to go.So if=
 you have a poor evp you can hear it leave it.
Tom

--- On Mon, 5/18/09, Er=
ic VanDuzer <evanduzer@...> wrote:

From: Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@gm=
ail.com>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] I have a question.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
=
Date: Monday, May 18, 2009, 9:11 AM








Now I may be biased to the "inv=
estigation" way of doing things.=A0 I do clean up evps if I hear something =
and can't make it out do to ambient noise.=A0 So hear is my question.=A0 Wh=
en do you stop cleaning up?=A0 Wouldn't to much enhancing "taint" the resul=
ts?=A0 To me the more enhancing you do the less convincing it becomes.=A0 I=
 hope noone finds this offensive, it is not meant to be I am just really cu=
rious.=A0 The way I look at it is that if you have to do so much enhancing =
to find anything, was there really something there to begin with.=A0 Are we=
 just making ourselves believe there is something there??

Eric

<DIV>Now I may be=

s if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise.  So h=
ear is my question.  When do you stop cleaning up?  Wouldn't to m=
uch enhancing "taint" the results?  To me the more enhancing you do th=
e less convincing it becomes.  I hope noone finds this offensive, it i=
s not meant to be I am just really curious.  The way I look at it is t=
hat if you have to do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really =
something there to begin with.  Are we just making ourselves believe t=
here is something there??<BR><BR>Eric<BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></t=
